nodes.text: Microweights were single-person ultra-light repulsor vehicles. Designed for the daring individual who liked to fly by the seat of their pants, microweights offered a discrete and delicate flying experience. Polymer wings were coated with a sealer derived from the cementing fluids of the Bactriasan scarab, which made the wings stronger than they appeared to be. Microweights were intended to be a recreational vehicle, but were often employed as emergency rescue vehicles.
One of the most popular microweights was the Hobbycraft Microweight produced by Illiseni Aerodyne.
